org.resthub.core.context.persistence
Class ScanningPersistenceUnitManager

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.orm.jpa.persistenceunit.DefaultPersistenceUnitManager
      org.resthub.core.context.persistence.ScanningPersistenceUnitManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.context.ResourceLoaderAware, org.springframework.context.weaving.LoadTimeWeaverAware, org.springframework.orm.jpa.persistenceunit.PersistenceUnitManager
public class ScanningPersistenceUnitManager
extends org.springframework.orm.jpa.persistenceunit.DefaultPersistenceUnitManager

Allow to scan JPA Entities in all dependencies (JAR) of the application, in order to allow modular JPA applications whith a model classes distributed in various modules. By default with JPA, this is not possible within the same persistence unit, so we implemented this using Spring classpath scanning capabilities. Sample Spring configuration : 

 <bean id="scanningPersistenceUnitManager"
 	class="org.resthub.core.domain.dao.jpa.ScanningPersistenceUnitManager">
 	<property name="defaultDataSource" ref="dataSource" />
 	<property name="classpathPatterns"
 		value="classpath&#42;:org/mydomain/myproject/&#42;&#42;/domain/model/&#42;.class" />
 </bean>
in case where no classpathPatterns is provided, this scanner search for entities in PersistenceContext filled during Spring loading of context files

Author:
bmeurant

Method Detail

getClasspathPatterns

public java.lang.String getClasspathPatterns()

setClasspathPatterns

public void setClasspathPatterns(java.lang.String classpathPatterns)
Classpath patterns to scan for entities (holding annotation MappedSuperclass or Entity. Pattern could use * or ** jokers You can specify more than one pattern by using , or ; separators Following values are valid classpath patterns : - classpath:org/mydomain/myproject/**/domain/model/*.class - classpath*:org/mydomain/myproject/**/domain/model/*.class - classpath*:org/mydomain/myproject1/**/domain/model/*. class, classpath*:org/mydomain/myproject2/**/domain/model/* ;.class Be attentive that using this property, entities-scan based configuration is ignored

Parameters:
classpathPatterns - The specified classpath patterns.

postProcessPersistenceUnitInfo

protected void postProcessPersistenceUnitInfo(org.springframework.orm.jpa.persistenceunit.MutablePersistenceUnitInfo pui)
This implementation scan the provided classpath to add resources matching with defined filters (or defaults). If no classpath pattern is defined, this scanner search for entities in PersistenceContext filled during Spring loading of context files. Entities found are then dynamically added to persistence context to be loaded as persistent resources

Overrides:
postProcessPersistenceUnitInfo in class org.springframework.orm.jpa.persistenceunit.DefaultPersistenceUnitManager
